pullRequest.body:
We create a new folder `RingTheory.IntegralClosure` and we move the relevant files (also doing some splitting).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6f9d71af89](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14826/commits/6f9d71af8989ec78750beca4393ef883a2a677b7)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.FieldTheory.Minpoly.Basic | 1186 | 1093 | -93 (-7.84%) |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.FractionalIdeal.Operations | 1190 | 1097 | -93 (-7.82%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
Too many changes (287)!

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

I don't really understand the difference between `Basic` and `Defs`, and the fact that `Defs` is more basic than `Basic` is confusing to me. IMHO that file should be split up into integral elements / integral algebras / integral closures instead.

> I don't really understand the difference between `Basic` and `Defs`, and the fact that `Defs` is more basic than `Basic` is confusing to me. IMHO that file should be split up into integral elements / integral algebras / integral closures instead.

`Defs` is more fundamental than `Basic` everywhere, isn't it? Anyway let me see if I can split the folder into three subfolders.
What do you think of this further splitting? (I still have to fix the docs)

I like the split, thanks! I still don't understand the `def` / `basic` split though (I learnt of it just now). It seems to me like a hack on low-hierarchical files to reduce imports, which IMO is not a problem here. This breaks the "when I need to find API lemmas, just `Go to Definition`" workflow that I (and maybe others?) rely on.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9976713581/job/27569589169)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9976713581/job/27569590868)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Split RingTheory.IntegralClosure
